cells.data:
Binomial Coefficients

$P(n,r) = \frac{n!}{(n-r)!}$
$C(n,r) = \frac{n!}{(n-r)! \cdot r!} = \frac{P(n,r)}{r!}$

Powers of binomials $(x+y)^n$
Use the $n^{th}$ row of Pascal's triangle

$(x+y)^n = \sum\limits_{k=0}^n \left( \begin{matrix} n \\ k \end{matrix} \right) x^{n-k} y^k$

The sum of the coefficients is $2^n$
Sum of alternatingly signed coefficients is $0$
